meanings.sent1: The students felt forced to attend the extra class after school.
meanings.sent2: The workers were forced to complete the task before the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the dog with a forced smile, trying to appear friendly.
meanings.sent4: The tree branches swayed in the wind, forced to bend under its powerful force.
meanings.sent5: The image of the locked door was forced into his memory, impossible to forget.

meanings.sent1: She felt forced to apologize even though she did nothing wrong.
meanings.sent2: The children were forced to clean up their toys before bedtime.
meanings.sent3: The robot made a forced attempt at dancing, causing laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: The river forced its way through the rocks, carving a new path.
meanings.sent5: The bright light forced her eyes to squint, shielding them from the glare.

meanings.sent1: The forced entry into the building left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent2: The confession seemed forced, lacking sincerity.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's forced jokes fell flat with the audience.
meanings.sent4: The storm forced the doors open, howling through the house.
meanings.sent5: The forced smile on her face did little to hide her true feelings.
